intro: Cichlanthus fuscus, commonly known as the dark cichlanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from deep red to purple. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a hairy texture. Cichlanthus fuscus thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests.
